util

tspsol2mp.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Given a TSPlib file and a corresponding solution file, this program will compute the total cost of the tour and if requested, create a PostScript file (generated by METAPOST) containing the graphical representation of the tour.

Author:
Farhan Ahammed (faha3615@mail.usyd.edu.au)

Definition in file tspsol2mp.c.

Function Documentation

void create_mp_file ( char *  solfilename  ) 

Creates a METAPOST file and uses the external mpost program to create a PostScript file containing a graphical representation of the solution.

Parameters:
solfilename The file name of the TSP solution file. This name is used to define the file name of the METAPOST file that will be created.

int extractNodeData ( char *  line,
int *  id,
int *  xcoord,
int *  ycoord 
)

Extracts the node/city's coordinates from the given string and places them in the variables pointed to by the given pointers.

The string must be formatted like so: "<i>ID x-coord y-coord</i>"

Parameters:
line A line from a TSPlib file containing a city's ID and position.
id The city's id is returned in this parameter.
xcoord The city's x-coordinate is returned in this parameter.
ycoord The city's y-coordinate is returned in this parameter.
Returns:
True (1) if the string contains "EOF". That is, there are no more cities left in the TSPlib file.

int isNodeCoordHeader ( char *  line  ) 

Returns true if the given line is "NODE_COORD_SECTION". That is, the city coordinates begins from the next line in the TSPlib file.
